title: Project-Based Learning for Improving Reading Motivation and Supporting Reading Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of foundational reading skills and basic awareness of reading disabilities or difficulties
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-enabled environments, focusing on developing reading motivation diagnostic tools and personalized intervention strategies

learning_goals: Participants can diagnose their motivation levels using the Survey of Motivation for Reading (SMQ) and write an interpretation report.
Participants can design and present as project deliverables three or more customized learning strategies aligned with reading disability characteristics.
Participants can revise and finalize their reading motivation improvement plans (including weekly action goals) based on peer feedback and present them.

resources: Assistive technology device rental service information
Case Studies on Students with Reading Disabilities
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
